oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Active Service Testament
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pocket New Testament with printed messages from President Wilson and General Pershing on the fly leaf and frontispiece. The page opposite the title page is stamped "AMERICAN ARMY AND NAVY Y.M.C.A./AMERICAN EXPEDITIONARY FORCES/U.S. BASE HOSPITAL 27/ FRANCE" with "Carl B. Curtis" overwritten. Below in a crude script " Earl E. Curtis/ Knoxville, Tenn./Co. S 116th Eng./Am. Ex. Forces, France." Earl Curtis served in various engineer units and served overseas from September 1918 until March 3, 1919.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World war, 1914-1918; World war, 1914-1918 - History
